current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to prohibit tax-exempt status to professional sports
			 leagues that promote the use of the term redskins.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

header.#text:
Special rule
			 relating to professional sports leagues

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text:
by redesignating
			 subsection (s) as subsection (t), and

by inserting
			 after subsection (r) the following new subsection:

term.#tail: in connection with any team or club connected with such professional sports league.

text.#text:
No professional sports league
				shall be treated as described in subsection (c)(6) if such
			 professional sports league promotes, or allows a member club or franchise
			 connected with such professional sports league to promote, the use of the
			 term

header.#text:
Special rule
				relating to professional sports leagues

text.#text:
The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable
			 years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2884 IS: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to prohibit tax-exempt status to professional sports leagues that promote the use of the term redskins.
